Trial_Design.evidence: Since 2014, 298 CAS procedures in 287 non-consecutive patients

Participants.evidence: 287 non-consecutive patients (203 men, mean age 70.5 ±8.6 years, 100% symptomatic/high risk lesions)

Intervention.evidence: performed using the Roadsaver stent and proximal (40%) or distal (60%) neuroprotection system

Objective.evidence: Aim: To assess immediate and long-term safety and effectiveness of CAS using the Roadsaver double-nitinol-layer-micromesh stent.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Clinical and neurological examinations as well as duplex ultrasound were completed before CAS, before discharge, at 1, 6 and 12 months, then annually.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Since 2014, 298 CAS procedures in 287 non-consecutive patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 4-year follow-up showed 82% overall survival (95% CI: 69–91%)

Harms.evidence: In hospital, 1 ipsilateral periprocedural major (0.3%) and 3 minor (1.34%) ischemic strokes occurred
